text: The Righteousness of God through Faith in Christ
Brothers, the desire of my heart and my prayer to God on behalf of them \add is\add* for \add their\add* salvation.
For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

For ignoring the righteousness of God, and seeking to establish their own,\f + \fr 10:3 \ft Some manuscripts have “their own righteousness” \f* they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.
For Christ \add is the\add* end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.

For Moses writes about the righteousness \add that is\add* from the law: “The person who does \add this\add*\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Some manuscripts explicitly state “these \fq things \ft ” \f* will live by it.”\f + \fr 10:5 \ft A quotation from \xt Lev 18:5 \ft \f*\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Some manuscripts have “them” \f*

But the righteousness from faith speaks like this: “Do not say in your heart,\f + \fr 10:6 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 9:4 \ft \f* ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ”\f + \fr 10:6 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 30:12 \ft \f* (that is, to bring Christ down),
or “Who will descend into the abyss?”\f + \fr 10:7 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 30:13 \ft \f* (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).
But what does it say? “The word is near to you, in your mouth and in your heart”\f + \fr 10:8 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 30:14 \ft \f* (that is, the word of faith that we proclaim),
that\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Or “because” \f* if you confess with your mouth “Jesus \add is\add* Lord” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
For with the heart one believes, resulting in righteousness, and with the mouth one confesses, resulting in salvation.
For the scripture says, “Everyone who believes in him will not be put to shame.”\f + \fr 10:11 \ft A quotation from \xt Isa 28:16 \ft \f*
For \add there\add* is no distinction between Jew and Greek, for the same \add Lord\add* \add is\add* Lord of all, who is rich to all who call upon him.
For “everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved.”\f + \fr 10:13 \ft A quotation from \xt Joel 2:32 \ft \f*

How then will they call upon \add him\add* in whom they have not believed? And how will they believe \add in him\add* about whom they have not heard? And how will they hear about \add him\add* without one who preaches \add to them\add*?

And how will they preach, unless they are sent? Just as it is written, “How timely \add are\add* the feet of those who bring good news of good things.”\f + \fr 10:15 \ft A quotation from \xt Isa 52:7 \ft ; \xt Nah 1:15 \ft \f*
But not all have obeyed the good news, for Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our report?”\f + \fr 10:16 \ft A quotation from \xt Isa 53:1 \ft \f*
Consequently, faith \add comes\add* by hearing, and hearing through the word about Christ.
But I say, they have not heard, have they?\ef + \fr 10:18 \ft *The negative construction in Greek anticipates a negative answer here \ef* On the contrary,
“Their voice has gone out to all the earth,
and their words to the ends of the inhabited world.”\f + \fr 10:18 \ft A quotation from \xt Ps 19:4 \ft \f*
But I say, Israel did not know, did they?\ef + \fr 10:19 \ft *The negative construction in Greek anticipates a negative answer here \ef* First, Moses says,
“I will provoke you \add to jealousy\add* by \add those who are\add* not a nation;
by a senseless nation I will provoke you \add to anger\add*.”\f + \fr 10:19 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 32:21 \ft \f*
And Isaiah is very bold and says,
“I was found by those who did not seek me;
I became known to those who did not ask for me.”\f + \fr 10:20 \ft A quotation from \xt Isa 65:1 \ft \f*
But about Israel he says,
“The whole day \add long\add* I held out my hands
to a disobedient and resistant people.”\f + \fr 10:21 \ft A quotation from \xt Isa 65:2 \ft \f*
